If you want it short, go look at the bottom, it says it briefly.

As much as I would love to like this game, I just can't. Every good piece of this game is muddied by a bloat of grinding, meta perks, annoying maps and poor balancing. Perk variety seems fun until you realize a number of them are meaningless compared to other items or perks that are direct upgrades. Perks themselves also are absolutely obtuse, demanding you either grind, wait, or pay to get it quick. A number of perks are simply unavailable to even be earned through grinding due to some killers and survivors being restricted to only paid DLC, making it so their abilities can only be achieved at the RNG shrine that only changes the 4 perks its selling once a week and also is picking from a massive perk pool. This means that perks that are restricted to DLC, particular perks you may want, can be locked behind a fairly solid pay wall. This on its own I find in a pretty low gray area for monetizing a game, but even with perks you have available, you have to grind for so painfully long.
Say you have Bill and you have Dwight. You want to play Dwight but Bill has Unbreakable and Borrowed Time. Dwight also has perks you may want to choose. The conundrum comes from having to grind two characters for an extensive time to have an interchangeable set of perks. Once you grind Dwight's perks, or Bill's, you can finally mix and match their perks. For two survivors. And you might say, "At least I have less grind when I just want to add one extra survivor to my roster." But that's not all. When you finally get to trying to unlock another survivor's perk on your own survivor, you have to hope and pray that the RNG of the bloodweb gives you the right perk and to the right tier you want, meaning you spend more BP, the currency, trying to just get the park on your survivor, on top of the lengthy grinding. And finally, once you increase your available perk pool, it eventually starts to bloat as well as other characters perks start filling up every survivor's bloodweb with perks you may not care to mix or grind for compared to others. 
Plant the same issue on killers who have even more variation between each other, with even higher perk dependency on some of them (perks they may not start with), and you have a grind hell that essentially means you will have to make DBD your job (and a job it certainly does feels like) to just get a build you want.

Go play another game that doesn't demand so much of your money and time. Please. It's not like the devs behind gameplay (not art design, they do just fine) care about taking the game out of its grind, ranking, and toxicity hell hole.

Great game that will make you go bald if you haven't already. The amount of stress this game provides is insane. Lots of laughs and jump-scares to be had as well.

I've not touched the game for a while because it drains you, and who wants that. Some maps are in favor of the killer, and some maps are in favor of the survivors.

The only way I will ever come back to this game is if they implement a new mode. 2 killers/8 survivors. That would pull me in again, and relieve stress from the normal matches. I've reached rank 2 every time I've played. So, don't think I suck as a survivor. But when you want to play with friends that suck, it puts a stress on you that makes the game a lot less fun. So, more players would ease the risk of your friends dying immediately. 

Anyways, no regrets buying the game, but I will not return.

They don't care about what the community says's and or wants. If you are thinking about getting this game DON'T DO IT! At least not until Behavior Interactive and their Devs change their behavior.

TLDR:
It's a great game, but terrible matchmaking and a toxic community makes it straigt up unplayable. 
Get away from it while you still can.

Full Comment:

Alright, positive things first.
- Good Graphics
- Good Concept
- Can be a lot of fun
- Interesting and changing Gameplay, giving Replay Value

Now the Negativ things.
-Terrible Matchmaking

     -> The Matchmaking in this game is a 'Skill-Based Matchmaking'. Sounds good on the 
    surface but it simply doesn't fit the game. It is absolutely Terrible, ignores what you do 
    during the game and just count if you win. But with the way the game work, you can 'win' by 
    being bad and just hiding while you can 'lose' when you are the pushing force to let your 
    team escape. That BS results in absolutely /terrible/ balanced matches.

-Competitive Gaming Experience forced Down your throat.

    -> The game is assymetrical. 1 vs 4. Playing that Competitive is just stress and no fun to 
    me at least. However there is only a ranked gamemode with hidden mmr and no casual 
    gameplay, except you have people who would play custom matches with you, /but/ you 
    don't get any currency for that.

-Toxic Community
   
    -> Not much to say about that. The community is incredible toxic, so toxic that even the big 
    influencer on twitch and Youtube have an issue with that.
    I personally received Death threats. I opened a Support ticket about that (With screenshots) and got told that they couldn't tell me anything but will look after it. A week later the account of the person still wasn't banned.
    I think it says more than enough that most of the community says to a) turn your profile private to prevent people targetting you and to b) turn off any communication in the game.

- Resolution Limiter
    -> since the last update you can't play in stretched resolution anymore. I got a 16:10 Monitor and two super ugly black lines on top and bottom while playing. It's to 'prevent unfair advantage'. (Just another ridiculous thing to further the competitive). Not even R6S, an ESPORT GAME, has this bs limiter.
This also affects the steam deck if anyone has that.

If you for some reason still want to play the game than there is 'The grind'.
I got over... 1500? hours in this game and i don't have all of the perks i need on my characters, and certainly not enough to make any joke builds. The grind is fun in my eyes but to anyone who can't spend 16 hours a day in the game it is just ridicoulus.

El sistema de MMR (matchmaking) del Dead by Daylight es una p*ta basura. Si os apetece comprar un juego y que os emparejen con killers de 3000 horas y haga vuestra experiencia de juego un infierno, pues adelante. Le he dado oportunidades durante los ultimos meses y unas 8 de cada 10 partidas estan desbalanceadas, jugando de superviviente o te tocan killers de 3000 horas en arriba (se lo pregunto, se que tienen ese tiempo de juego) o te toca con otros que no llegan a las 50 y te aburres igualmente porque no te suponen un reto. Pero lo normal son killers de 3000 horas.

Normal que la comunidad esté dejando el juego. Si hacen las cosas mal, que lo arreglen, pero las estadísticas de jugadores de Steam hablan por si solas. Des de que se instauro el MMR automatico, la gente ha ido dejando el juego.

Saludos.
